text: [Music]
nimbus was a product of us as a
publisher being frustrated with an
inefficient market and a lack of control
over ads in our app we knew our
monetization team could do so much more
if they had the data and the visibility
into how our inventory was performing we
built a more transparent auction with as
many of our trusted partners as we could
and we were finally in control of
optimizing our ad revenue
we quickly realized that our product was
growing and we needed something to match
that growth we saw limitations with
other solutions around supporting
billing and scaling new acquired clients
with aws we can provision hardware on
the fly to meet those needs that
flexibility not only allowed us to
accelerate at our own pace but also
allowed us to forecast and accurately
support our infrastructure at any given
time we've been able to grow a lot more
than teams our size usually can at this
stage by implementing file conversion
glue jobs nimbus saw improved athena
query performance from 15 to 30 minutes
down to 20 seconds while providing a
significant reduction in athena costs
and consistent and predictable costs
with aws glue by leveraging aws timehop
was able to pivot its business and
generate a new revenue stream by
productizing the ms very quickly aws
organizations let us physically separate
nimbus from timehop while maintaining
this single relationship with aws
this let us understand the cost of
nimbus separate from our other lines of
business
we were able to create our mvp for
advanced reporting with this original
setup and we were able to improve athena
query performance and reduce costs by
leveraging glue from a technical
perspective you can have a data center
with hundreds of additional value-add
services at your disposal to create
anything you can imagine without the
traditional capital expenditure
for us we've always embraced limitations
as creative challenges
finding new approaches to what seemed
out of reach meant we were able to
develop products that serviced a much
larger scale than anyone thought a small
team could i see us continuing to work
closely with our account manager and
technical account manager as we grow
it's helpful to get their perspective on
new and old things going on at nimbus
with access to their data and
alleviating unnecessary hoops in the
ecosystem to deliver optimal spo
nimbus's goal becomes more of a reality
don't be afraid to put something out in
the world and have it fail because most
things will fail many times before
taking off just don't fail in the same
way twice
[Music]
